byline.contributor: Richard Fausset and Kalyn Wolfe reported from Mobile, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.
byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and KALYN WOLFE

abstract: Alabama probate judges weighing whether they should grant marriage licenses to gay couples are caught between federal and state rulings on issue, not to mention their own feelings toward it; federal hearing has been scheduled to resolve matter.
lead_paragraph: The hearing could determine whether resistant local probate judges must grant licenses to gay and lesbian couples.

headline.main: Federal Judge Sets Hearing in Alabama on Same-Sex Marriage
headline.print_headline: Federal Judge Sets Hearing in Alabama on Same-Sex Marriage

snippet: The hearing could determine whether resistant local probate judges must grant licenses to gay and lesbian couples.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
